attributes.action: All parties to provide there target migrant limits as part of there Manifesto.
attributes.additional_details:
By definition, by not having predetermined migrant levels, means that any level of immigration is “uncontrolled” This is widely accepted as the single biggest topic for the electorate today, yet it has never had any say in the matter. The fact this is not disclosed by any political party is making the topic divisive in the absence of any template.
The electorate should be able to make their own decision based on each Parties Manifesto pledge as to what is appropriate for themselves.
attributes.background: The British public has never had any choice in the levels of the migrant population within the Country. Currently, any Government can increase or decrease migrant levels as they see fit. These levels should be made transparent and a compulsory disclosure within every Party Manifesto.

rejection.details:
Political parties are responsible for their manifestos. 

This is not something which the UK Government or Parliament is responsible for.
